Transcript:
Alan: Yes, you heard me right. Phillip has 
proof that you murdered Beth. Not that we didn't know it all along. But this 
time the charges will stick.

Edmund: I did not murder Beth. She died in a 
flash flood. The only thing I'm guilty of is not being able to save her life, 
though God knows I tried.
Alan: Well, we'll see about that.

Edmund: What possible reason would I have in 
the world to kill her? We loved each other.

Alan: That's what you brainwashed her into 
believing. When she finally came to her senses, she went to Mexico to get a 
divorce. You followed her down there and victimized her even more. This time it 
cost her her life. That's the way it was, Edmund.

Edmund: We were working towards a 
reconciliation.

Alan: In your dreams! It's too bad she's not 
here to speak for herself.

Edmund: Believe me, I would like nothing 
better.
(Cell phone rings)

Alan: Yes. Really? The mob? Well, that's good 
information to know.

Edmund: Thank God you're in the room. What 
are you doing?

Lorelei: Why? What's it matter what I’m 
doing?

Edmund: It looks as if I'm going to have to 
push up the date of your grand entrance into Springfield society.
Lorelei: How come?

Edmund: You let me worry about that. You 
spend your time becoming a convincing Beth as quickly as possible.
Lorelei: I can pass for her right now.

Edmund: Oh, really? Could you? What's your 
ex-husband's name?
Lorelei: Which one?

Edmund: Well, let's try the tall millionaire 
who fathered your children.
Lorelei: Well, I know it. It's Fenton.

Edmund: Oh, Fenton, that was very good.  
Phillip! Good god, you can't get this one wrong. Of all people, Phillip has to 
believe you're Beth or we're sunk. Now stay right where you are. I'm going to 
come up and we're going to work on this, we're going to drill it into your 
skinny little head until you get it right.

Lorelei: Drill by yourself, darling. I've 
been studying for hours. This girl needs a break. Yeah, mm.

Danny: I swear, you know, when I went after the job at Spaulding, I had no 
intention of getting an inside opportunity to steal $25 million from them. I 
didn't. Now it looks like I've got no choice.

Michelle: Honey, it's a sting, though. And 
whoever's behind this, he's going to end up in prison, not you. Okay?
Danny: Well, we hope. We hope so.

Rick: I'm just going to pretend that I just 
didn't hear the word prison just now.
Danny: No, Michelle's...
Rick: What's going on, guys?

Danny: ...Michelle's just talking about maybe 
doing some volunteer work at the local prison, you know, a reading program, a 
literacy program for the inmates.

Rick: Of course. Right, with all that extra 
time that you have as a mom raising a little boy.

Michelle: Well, speaking of moms, have you 
spoken to Harley yet?

Rick: Have we spoken, no, not since she 
called me to tell me that she is driving cross-country so she can have our baby 
boy here at home. The only problem is that the woman is literally ready to give 
birth at any moment, and she's still driving across country anyway, and I 
haven't heard from her since, so...
Michelle: Which has you worried.

Rick: Of course it does, Michelle. I mean, 
why couldn't she just, you know, pick up a phone and call me?
Danny: What? Is something wrong?

Rick: This is Harley's cell phone number. She 
called me.
Michelle: Did she leave a message?
Rick: No, this is nuts. This is crazy.
Michelle: Why didn't you hear it ring?

Rick: I'm trying to figure it out, Michelle. 
I mean, I've had this phone with me all after... Wait a minute. I accidentally 
switched phones with Gus Aitoro.

Danny: Well, how did that happen? When did 
you do that?

Rick: It was a couple of hours ago, but we 
switched it right... During that time he got a call from Harley and he didn't 
tell me. Why wouldn't he tell me?
Danny: Why? Because he's Gus Aitoro.

Rick: This is nuts. Come on, Harley. Where 
are you? Come on.
Harley: (Gasping) Where is everybody? Dudley!
(Cell phone ringing)

Harley: Dudley... 
Dudley, come on, you've got to help me here, buddy. Oh, God, at least answer my 
phone. Dudley! Oh, oh, gosh. I am not having a baby alone in a jail cell.

(Cell 
phone ringing)
Harley: Help! Can anybody hear me?

Rick: Come on. Can't you hear the phone 
ringing? Pick it up. Answer it!

Harley: Oh, it's you, Rick. It's you, isn't 
it? I know it's you. Oh, I know it's you. Okay. Don't hang up. I have a plan. 
(Gasping) Here I come. I'm coming. Oh! Oh, come on, please. Please!

Rick: You called me almost an hour ago, why 
wouldn't you have the phone on now? Oh, God.
Harley: (Whimpering) Great.

Gus: Would this be your first visit to 
Brewster Falls?
Josh: Wife approaching with wine-- one of my favorite images.
Olivia: Yeah?
Josh: Yeah.
Olivia: How does this one rate?
Josh: Definitely in the top ten. Cheers.
Olivia: Cheers.
Josh: Life is good again.

Olivia: You know, that's all I've ever 
wanted, Josh, for us, for things to be good.

Josh: Well, I'll tell you what, how about if 
we bump it up a notch? Maybe we can get to incredible. How would that be?
Olivia: Oh, okay. I'm ready if you are.

Josh: I think we've paid our dues. (Phone 
rings)

Olivia: Don't answer it. Don't answer it. 
Come on.
Josh: You know what? It might be important.
Olivia: It could be a telemarketer.
Josh: Yeah. I'll be quick, I promise. Hello?
Shayne: (Whispering throughout) Hi, Dad?
Josh: Son, why are you whispering?
Shayne: Because I don't want Mom to hear.
Josh: Why not?

Shayne: Because it's about her. Look, 
something weird is going on. Do you hear me?

Josh: Yes, son, I heard you. But see, I can't 
really get involved in your mother's problems right now.

Shayne: Dad, look, who do you want me to talk 
to, Uncle Billy or Father Ray?
Josh: No. No. Okay. What's the problem?

Shayne: Ever since mom came back from that 
bed and breakfast place, I mean, well, she brought home a painting.
Josh: A painting.

Shayne: Yeah, it's a painting of a seashore 
with sand and rocks and all that stuff. Anyway, it's just like... It was cruddy, 
and dirty, and I decided I was going to clean it, and I spilled the cleaning 
goop all over the painting, and I wiped it off, and the seashore disappeared and 
there was another painting underneath it.
Josh: Of what?

Shayne: See, that's the whole thing. I don't 
know because Mom has cloth over it and she won't let anyone see it. I mean, 
she's looking at it right now. It looks like she's hypnotized or something. I 
mean, it's really creeping me out, Dad.

Josh: Okay. Well, I'm sure there's an 
explanation. I'll tell you what, I'll look into it, I promise.
Shayne: Do it soon. Bye.
Reva: Hey there.

Shayne: Hey. Mom, I'm going to go to the 
movies with Chris and Dave.
Reva: Oh, okay. Great. Fine.

Shayne: You sure you'll be okay home alone 
and everything?

Reva: Yeah, why wouldn't I be? Come here. 
Have a good time. Okay?
Shayne: Yeah.
Reva: Okay. See you later.
Shayne: Bye.

Reva: Why do I keep hearing you, Mama? Huh? 
And why do you keep telling me to trust my heart? Does it have something to do 
with this painting?
Olivia: So, it was about Reva?

Josh: No, it's actually about a painting. I 
know that sounds strange, but see, Shayne is spooked for some reason. It has 
something to do with a painting... You know, maybe... maybe he just misses the 
drama of having Marah live under the same roof.
Olivia: So he's just creating his own dramas?

Josh: I think that's possible, yes. Listen, 
listen, I'm not going to go running off and getting involved in Reva's problems, 
all right? That's not going to happen.

Olivia: Well, I like the sound of that. Oh. (
Phone rings) No, I'm going to get this one. It's my turn. Hello?

Alan: Olivia, I need to see you right away-- 
now, as a matter of fact.
Olivia: My husband and I aren't interested.

Alan: Ah, so you're not alone. Well, see that 
you are within an hour, or Josh just might find out about Lewis holdings.
Olivia: I'm hanging up now.

Alan: Does he know that you're using his name 
to commit fraud? I'm on my way.

Olivia: Okay, well, that was a telemarketer. 
You thought it was Shayne again, didn't you?

Josh: I just... He rattled me a bit, that's 
all. You know, Shayne doesn't usually care about what's going on with other 
people, but he seems to be real worried about his mom right now.

Olivia: You know, maybe you ought to go over 
there and just see what's up with her.
Josh: Are you sure about that?

Olivia: Well, if it will calm Shayne down, 
I'm all for it. Go, go. Go be a dad.

Josh: Okay. Okay. All right. Thank you. I'll 
tell you what, I'll... I won't be long.
Olivia: That's okay. Take your time.
Josh: Okay.
Harley: What are you doing here?

Gus: Well, I just came by to see what you 
look like in a jail cell. You look kind of cute. Take it easy, Coop.
Harley: Mm-hmm. Not so fast, meathead.

Gus: Oh, that's funny, meathead. I'm out 
here, you're in there, you're calling me meathead. Is that any way to talk to 
your former colleague? Is it? And what did you do to this guy? Look at this poor 
schlub. He's out cold.
Harley: (Groans)

Gus: Secret-- that's not a way get yourself 
out of a paper..
Harley: (Groaning)

Gus: And don't be a drama queen. Look, some 
things never change. You don't have to start screaming. I'll help you get out.

Harley: I am not screaming, I am having a 
contraction!

Gus: Yeah. Yeah, you're having a contraction. 
Right.
Harley: Do I look like I'm joking to you?

Gus: What do you mean, you're having a 
contraction?

Harley: I mean I'm in labor. I am in labor, 
which is why I called Rick the doctor, not you, the idiot.

Gus: Hold it. Hold it! Are you serious? 
You're in labor?

Harley: Yes, which means I'm having a baby. I 
am having a baby. See, my water broke and everything.

Gus: Cooper, you can't have a kid in the... 
You can't have a kid in this place.

Harley: You think? I thought it would be a 
good time.

Gus: No, no, I don't mean it like that. I 
mean, it's stupid. I don't... I didn't mean to say it like that. Look, I'm going 
to get you out of this cage and to a hospital, okay?
Harley: Good.

Gus: I'm going to do that. And I'm sorry. And 
listen, I'll tell you something, this is like an honor for me to protect you and 
the baby, and to get you to a... no birth house jail baby's for you...
Harley: Aitoro, Aitoro...

Gus: I feel proud. I mean, I'm starting to 
feel proud to make you...
Harley: Aitoro, come here. Come closer to me.
Gus: I'm saying...

Harley: Aitoro, you find that key and you get 
me out this cell, or I'm going to cut you up into pieces small enough to fit 
through these bars. You know what I mean?
Gus: Yeah.
Harley: Get the key.
Gus: That's what I was saying.
Alan: Well, Edmund, it's starting to sink in, isn't it? The jig's up.

Edmund: The jig's up, yes. I think I've heard 
that someplace before. Look, you haven't seen my friend Josephine, have you? She 
wasn't in the bar or anything?

Alan: Oh, you still can't locate your lady 
friend, huh? She left without so much as a good-bye note. Funny how this always 
happens to you.

Edmund: So I take you don't know where she 
is.

Alan: Oh, she could be anywhere, Edmund. Why 
don’t you try Mexico? But you'd better hurry and track her down because she 
might find a man who treats women decently.

Edmund: Oh, you insufferable blowhard. Where 
the hell are you, Lorelei? You're not ready to play Beth yet, not nearly. My 
plan is going to be ruined if someone mistakes you for Beth too soon, especially 
if that someone is...

Michelle: So I guess the only thing that we can do now is to go ahead with our 
plan to set up our Mr. Big.
Danny: First thought, best thought.
Michelle: $25 million.
Danny: That's a lot of money.

Michelle: Yeah. To make or to steal. In this 
case, I don't even know which is harder.

Danny: I guarantee you, stealing it is going 
to be a whole hell of a lot easier. A couple of keystrokes.
Michelle: Wait a minute.
Danny: What?

Michelle: Once you hack into Spaulding's 
computer and you transfer these funds to Mr. Big, how is Frank supposed to nail 
this guy for receiving stolen funds?

Danny: Well, I'm going to give Frank all the 
software and the passwords so that he can electronically flag the money that 
belongs to Spaulding.

Michelle: Okay, and then Mr. Big gets 
arrested, and then...
Danny: That's the idea.

Michelle: ...The families take a huge hit and 
they'll be too weak to stop you from leaving.
Danny: Mm-hmm.

Michelle: But I think you're already free of 
them inside.
Danny: Why do you say that? What do you mean?

Michelle: You didn't shut me out when Carlos 
came to you and asked you for a favor. You needed me, and you were man enough to 
admit it, and that is certainly not the Santos way.

Danny: Man, enough. Well, we're a team. 
Anyway, I'm not doing this to get just myself away from the families. I'm doing 
this for all of us: For you, and Robbie, too. It's worth fighting for.
Michelle: Together.

Danny: Right. Right. And even though I'll be 
doing all the legwork to make this happen, I know that I'll feel you beside me 
all the way.
Michelle: Then it has to work.

Danny: It will. Come on, eat your pie. Is it 
good?
Messenger: Mr. Santos?
Danny: Yeah?
Messenger: Here you are, sir.
Danny: Oh, it's from Spaulding. Thank you.
Messenger: Thank you.

Danny: Thanks very much. They really do find 
you wherever you are. It looks like the game just got a little tougher for us.
Rick: All right, let's just try it one more time. Come on.
Gus: Listen to me, I'm going to call 911.
Harley: No.
Gus: Yes.
Harley: No!

Gus: Yes. They can have an emergency vehicle 
here in like five minutes.

Harley: No, I am not having this baby in an 
ambulance, and I'm not having it in a jail cell, either.
Gus: There's not enough time.
Harley: There's is time.
Gus: There's not enough time!

Harley: There's time for you to find the 
keys, not much more than that.
Gus: I'm going to find the keys.

Harley: Good. Good. They're not here. I don't 
know where they are. Well, we know where they aren't.

Gus: You know what? Listen to me. I have 
known women that have been in, like, labor for two to like 11 days and the kid 
stays up in there, okay?
Harley: Yeah, but not when it's their third.
Gus: Third?
Harley: Yeah.

Gus: Here, this... Squeeze tight. Don't 
breathe. Do everything opposite that they say. Just hold on tight. Squeeze your 
legs together, okay? It's going to be okay.
Harley: Answer that!
Gus: Hello? Hello? Doc?
Rick: What? Who's this?

Gus: Who's this? Doc, who's that? Is that 
you?
Rick: Aitoro? What are you doing there?

Gus: It is the doc. Hey, we were just talking 
about you, our favorite doctor.
Rick: Where's Harley?
Gus: She's right here.

Harley: Rick, Rick, I'm in labor in Brewster 
Falls. I'm in jail. You have to get me out of here.
Rick: Jail? Labor? What the hell's going on?
Harley: You have to get me out of here.
Gus: It's a bad connection.
Harley: Don't leave me with this guy, please!

Gus: We're wasting time. We lost the signal. 
Look, this guy... This guy is going to have to be good enough, okay?

Rick: Hello? Hello? Brewster Falls. Right. 
I'm there. There's no way that you can have my son without me.
Phillip: You look worried, Edmund.
Edmund: I've had a lot on my mind.

Phillip: Well, you can start thinking about 
prison, now, because I finally figured out why you killed Beth.
Edmund: This is ridiculous.

Phillip: It was just about money, wasn't it? 
That's all it was about. How much did you really think you were going to be able 
to dig out of that miserable hole in Colorado?

Edmund: I loved Beth for who she was, not 
what she had. That mine meant nothing to me.

Phillip: Well, you know what? That's not what 
your pal Gomez said.
Edmund: Gomez?

Phillip: Gomez. You remember Gomez. Skinny 
guy, needs a bath, has a bad attitude? Gee, that's funny Edmund, because he and 
his pal Cruz seem to remember a hell of a lot about you.
Edmund: They're here?

Phillip: Yeah, they're here. I just had a 
little unscheduled meeting with them over at your room at the Springfield inn.
Edmund: What did they want?

Phillip: You, or at least for you to sign 
over your deed to Beth's mine. But it's okay. Actually, you don't have to worry 
about it. I think I screwed up their plans for the time being. I'm sure they're 
long gone by now. But the important thing is they left something behind, one 
hell of a story about how you paid them to kidnap Beth.
Edmund: Well, they're lying criminals.

Phillip: Why would they do that? Just stop 
for a second and think about that. Why would they do that? Why would they 
incriminate themselves like that? It doesn't make any sense. See, I think I 
believe them.
Edmund: Well, then you're a fool.

Phillip: Really? Okay. Well, we'll see, won't 
we, once you go to trial.

Edmund: You've got nothing on me because 
there is nothing.

Phillip: You had motive, you had means and 
you had the opportunity to kill her, and you know what? That's enough for a 
jury. You're finished. And the very, very best part about this is that you dug 
your own grave.
Olivia: Have you been spying on me?

Alan: Just gathering information. The mob? 
You turned to the mob rather than deal with me?

Olivia: You know, I don't know where you got 
this so-called information, but it's totally off-base.

Alan: So my money's not good enough for you, 
is that it? It's clean. I'm not in the business of breaking legs. I've broken a 
few hearts from time to time, but not legs.
Olivia: Oh, put that back on.

Alan: You know, after the black eye the 
Lewis' received on this bribery...
Olivia: Josh was cleared of everything!

Alan: ...I would think you would go to 
extremes to protect your company from bad press, and Josh from finding out with 
whom his wife is dealing.

Olivia: Stop it! You won't go to Josh or the 
media with any of this.
Alan: Really?

Olivia: No. Because if you do, you'll lose 
your hold over me, and then you'll lose me forever.

Alan: I think Holly Reade would love an 
exclusive of the make-up of Lewis holdings.

Olivia: You don't get it. You still don't get 
it. You think you have all the power-- of course you always do- - but you're 
wrong. See, I know... I know how much you love sleeping with me, how much you 
love touching me, and having me, and I know how much you want it again, Alan. 
That is why you're here, isn't it?
Alan: That's enough.

Olivia: See, I know what it's like to be 
hungry, to need something so bad you can taste it. I guess we're similar like 
that, but don't you dare come into my home and expect me to make love to you in 
my husband's bed. I won't stand for your bully tactics anymore. You keep them 
up, and you'll never see me again.
Alan: No one talks to me like this.

Olivia: Guess what? I just did. I think we 
understand each other now, don't we, Alan? (Door slams)
(Knock at door)
Josh: Hi, there. Can I come in?
Reva: Hey. Uh, I... I don't know.
Josh: Okay. Is Shayne here?

Reva: No. He's at a movie with some friends. 
Why?
Josh: He called me. He's worried about you.
Reva: Come in.
Josh: Thank you.

Reva: You know, I... I think that Shayne is 
taking this man of the house thing just a step too far, because he is worried, 
but I'm fine. Don't I look fine?

Josh: Yeah, you look great. And I realize 
that it's strange for me to be here considering the fact that I told you to stay 
out of my life recently, but you have... You've gone through quite a bit.
Reva: Well...

Josh: Well, I mean, come on, earthquake, 
blindness, and a fiancée breaking things off, it's almost biblical, Reva.

Reva: Yeah, well, it's just another chapter 
in the life of Reva Shayne.
Josh: He said something about a painting.
Reva: Did he?
Josh: Yeah. What's the deal?

Reva: There's no deal. It's some funny 
seascape that I bought at that B&B that I was staying at.

Josh: Right. How was that, by the way? Did 
you find what you were looking for?
Reva: I'm not sure.

Josh: Okay. Well, just do what you always do. 
You know, trust your heart.
Reva: What did you just say?
Michelle: Bad news?

Danny: Mm-hmm. It's from Phillip, from his 
office. They've decided to move up the installation of the new security system 
at Spaulding.
Michelle: The one that you designed?

Danny: Yeah. Yep. They started today, which 
means it's going to be up and running in, well, by the end of next week.
Michelle: Okay. Why is that a problem?

Danny: Because, honey, I was planning on 
doing this transfer with the old system intact. With this new system, with my 
system, this mainframe computer room is going to be completely sealed. There's 
no way I'll be able to get in there without somebody knowing.

Michelle: There's no way at all? Nothing you 
can do?

Danny: Not unless you come in from above. I 
mean, that room is going to be so sensitized that there's no way I'll be able to 
lower myself in there without setting off the alarm.

Michelle: Well, Danny, we can't just give up 
on this plan. I mean, our lives, yours, mine and Robbie's depend on this $25 
million being transferred.

Danny: Honey, who said anything about giving 
up? I didn't. I'm thinking that I'm going to have to lower you in there. It's 
going to be a hell of a lot easier than you trying to lower me.
Michelle: What are you saying?

Danny: Honey, we can't bring anybody else 
into this. You're going to have to be the one who breaks into that computer 
room. You're going to have to, or we're finished.
Gus: I'm a little bit crazy, but I'm a pro.
Harley: Would you shut up?
Gus: I have skills, you know.
Harley: Please!

Gus: Well, you're not making this any easier. 
Will you just calm down?

Harley: Why didn't you just give the phone to 
Rick?
Gus: Yeah, Rick.
Harley: He'd be here right now.

Gus: He couldn't find the key any easier than 
I can, okay? The key is not here. (Rattling)
Harley: (Groaning)

Gus: Come on, it's open. Come on. I'm taking 
you to the hospital. Come on.
Harley: No...
Gus: Yes, it's okay.
Harley: ...You're not.

Gus: I'll get you there. My car is right 
outside. I'll get you there in five minutes, all right? To the delivery room.

Harley: You're not listening to me. The 
baby's coming.
Gus: Well, I'll call 911.

Harley: No, no, no. You don't understand. The 
baby's coming now. The baby's coming now. You are going to have to deliver the 
baby.
Josh: I said trust your heart.
Reva: Why did you choose those exact words?

Josh: I don't know. I guess I chose them 
because they're appropriate. I want you to be happy, and the best way I know to 
find happiness is to trust your heart, that's it.

Reva: Well, that's what you've done, right? I 
mean, you're happy, now with Olivia, right?
Josh: Yes.

Reva: I mean, Marah was commenting on what a 
big help Olivia was when she moved into her dorm room. And you know, Marah and 
Shayne seem to have come around as far as she's concerned.
Josh: How about you?

Reva: Well, I don't really think it matters 
exactly what I think of Olivia. But Marah and Shayne, they... I think it's 
important that they like her.

Josh: I appreciate your saying that. From the 
beginning I've wanted Olivia to be considered as, you know, just part of the 
family by Marah and Shayne.

Reva: What exactly do you know about her 
family?
Josh: (Laughs) Not much, really. Why?

Reva: I was just curious. But you know what? 
You don't have to worry about me because I'm not going nuts.
(Laughs)
Josh: Okay.
Reva: Not yet, anyway.
Josh: Okay.
Reva: I promise.
Josh: Let me know if you do.
Reva: Oh, you'll be the first one I tell.
Josh: Okay, all right.
Reva: Have a good evening.
Josh: I will. You have a good evening, too.
Reva: Okay.
Josh: Bye.

Reva: Bye. (Eerie wind blowing) I hear what 
you're saying to me, Mama, in whatever voice it is you speak to me through, and 
I want to follow my heart and trust it and I will. I'll try. Trust. Trust.

Edmund: Well, since you don't have the authority to hold me, and I haven't been 
charged with any crime...

Phillip: Oh, you'll be charged. I can promise 
you that.
Edmund: Oh, the Spaulding word?

Phillip: Justice. You're the reason that Beth 
is dead. Beth?
Harley: I can't believe this.
Gus: Yeah, you can't believe...
Harley: I can't believe this.
Gus: Yeah. Uh-huh.

Harley: Hey, for your information, I don't 
want you touching me.
Gus: I'm not going to touch you.

Harley: And I don't want you touching the 
baby.
Gus: Right.

Harley: But I don't have a choice because 
you're the only one here. You have to deliver this baby. Oh...
(Sobbing)

Gus: You have a job, buddy. We can do this 
thing. Listen to me, Coop. I want you to breathe, okay? Breathe. I just want you 
to relax. Okay, that's what they say, right? They say relax.

Harley: You still think it's better that
